conclusion: In the process of chip manufacturing, ion implantation is a crucial step. Ions are accelerated and enter a velocity selector horizontally, then pass through a magnetic analyzer, which selects ions with a specific charge-to-mass ratio.
Subsequently, the ions are deflected by a deflection system and implanted into a wafer lying in the horizontal plane.
The uniform magnetic fields in the velocity selector, magnetic analyzer, and deflection system all have a magnetic induction magnitude of B, directed outward perpendicular to the plane of the paper.

The uniform electric fields in the velocity selector and deflection system have an electric field magnitude of E, directed vertically upwards and outward perpendicular to the plane of the paper, respectively.
The cross-section of the magnetic analyzer is a quarter-circular ring with inner and outer radii of R1 and R2, respectively, with small apertures at the center positions M and N at its ends.
In the deflection system, the electric and magnetic fields are distributed within the same cube with side length L.
The bottom of the deflection system is parallel to the horizontal plane of the wafer, and the distance between them is L as well.
When no electric or magnetic field is applied to the deflection system, the ions are injected vertically onto point O on the wafer.
The entire system is in a vacuum, and the gravitational force on ions is negligible.
The deflection angles of ions caused by the electric and magnetic fields are both small.
When α is small, we have sinα ≈ tanα ≈ α, and cos α ≈ 1-1/2α².
To solve the problem, we need to determine the velocity v of the ions after passing through the velocity selector and the charge-to-mass ratio of the ions selected by the magnetic analyzer.
The velocity selector consists of a uniform electric field E and a uniform magnetic field B directed perpendicular to the plane of the paper.

premise: The electric field exerts a force qE on the ion, and the magnetic field exerts a force qvB on the ion.
conclusion: For the ion to pass through the velocity selector without being deflected, these forces must be balanced: qE = qvB.
Solving for the velocity v: v = E/B.
The magnetic analyzer consists of a uniform magnetic field B directed perpendicular to the plane of the paper.
